text: Edward Theodore "Teddy" Riley (born October 8, 1967) is a Grammy Award winning, American singer-songwriter, musician, keyboardist, and record producer. He is credited with the creation of the New Jack Swing.Hogan, Paul. "[ Teddy Riley biography]" Allmusic Retrieved on September 19, 2009 The musicians with whom Riley has been connected include Michael Jackson, Keith Sweat, and Mike Posner. ==Career== Riley started a band called Guy with Aaron Hall and Timmy Gatling in 1987. They have released three albums. In 1994 Riley started another band called Blackstreet. They have released four albums. Riley co-produced half of Michael Jackson's 1991 album Dangerous. It is the best- selling new jack swing album ever released. ==References== Category:Singers from New York City Category:People from Harlem Category:American Grammy Award winners Category:1967 births Category:Living people
title: Teddy Riley
